greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) is the sum over all Motzkin paths of length n of products over all peaks p of (k*x_p+y_p)/y_p, where x_p and y_p are the coordinates of peak p; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(x, y, t, k) option remember; `if`(y>x or y<0, 0,
+b(x-1, y, false, k) +b(x-1, y+1, true, k)))
mathematica: b[x_, y_, t_, k_] := b[x, y, t, k] = If[y > x || y < 0, 0, If[x == 0, 1, b[x - 1, y - 1, False, k]*If[t, (k*x + y)/y, 1] + b[x - 1, y, False, k] + b[x - 1, y + 1, True, k]]];
Table[A[n, d - n], {d, 0, 12}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 04 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 25 2015
